item.title: VirtuaLightJS
item.description: In 2017 I started studying computer graphics at school. We were given a lot of boiler plate code during practical exercises. Sometimes it felt like everything was working through some kind of dark magic. It was especially frustrating when something wouldn’t work because there were too many unknowns. So during the summer holiday I gave myself the goal to write my own prototype from scratch. I decided to use WebGL because I knew a little JavaScript and figured it had the fastest iteration cycle.
